meanings.definition: An act of moving something back to a previous position or state.
meanings.sent1: The rollback of the boulder to its original spot was a difficult task.
meanings.sent2: The rollback of the car to the parking space was necessary for safety.
meanings.sent3: The rollback of the clock made everyone think it was time to go home early.
meanings.sent4: The rollback of the river to reveal hidden treasures amazed the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The rollback of the carpet revealed a long-lost toy underneath.

meanings.definition: A reduction or decrease in price or value.
meanings.sent1: The rollback of the candy price made it affordable for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The rollback of the house value was unexpected in the current market.
meanings.sent3: The rollback of the ice cream price caused a rush of customers to the store.
meanings.sent4: The rollback of the stock value left investors worried about their savings.
meanings.sent5: The rollback of the ticket price for the concert made it a must-attend event.

meanings.definition: A cancellation or reversal of a decision or action.
meanings.sent1: The rollback of the meeting decision surprised everyone in the team.
meanings.sent2: The rollback of the software update was due to unforeseen bugs.
meanings.sent3: The rollback of the party invitation caused confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The rollback of the policy change brought relief to the employees.
meanings.sent5: The rollback of the game rule change made the players happy.
